New Records: Taskin Ahmed achieved his best T20I bowling figures with four wickets for 25 runs.
Key Match Events: Taskin Ahmed took four wickets for 25 runs, leading Bangladesh to victory.
Hasan Mahmud took two important wickets for Bangladesh.
The Netherlands lost two wickets in the first two balls of their innings.
Shakib Al Hasan conceded a six off his first ball but then contributed to two run-outs in the same over.
Colin Ackermann scored a heroic knock for the Netherlands but lacked support from his teammates.
Scott Edwards and Colin Ackermann had a 44-run stand for the fifth wicket.
Soumya Sarkar defended 24 runs in the last over, conceding 14 runs with a six and a wicket off the last ball.
Mustafizur Rahman conceded only eight runs in the 19th over, making it difficult for the Netherlands.
Pre-Game Insights: The Netherlands won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Post-Match Reflections: After registering their first Super 12 Round win against the Netherlands, the Bangladesh team will be full of confidence to play their second T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa on October 27 in Sydney.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh posted a total of 144 for eight.
Afif Hossain was the best batter for Bangladesh, scoring 38 runs.
Najmul Hossain Shanto posted the second highest score of 25 runs.
Mosaddek Hossain scored 20 off 12 balls, helping Bangladesh post a fighting total.
For the Netherlands, Paul van Meekeren and Bas de Leede took two wickets each.
